text: It's time to explore the dashboards and risk insights that give management complete visibility into grievance trends.
The system is built with a multilayer structure allowing separate dashboards for sites, business units and different management levels.
This ensures that site teams, compliance staff and senior leadership each see insights relevant to their role.
Users can apply location and date filters to view data by site, department, supplier or branch and analyze trends across specific time periods.
This makes it easy to compare performance and detect recurring issues.
The Grievance Overview provides a complete snapshot of total complaints, anonymous cases, closed and in process cases, and bounced or unclosed complaints.
Category wise chart group complaints by issue type, such as wages, working hours, harassment or health and safety.
It helps management prioritize corrective and preventive actions where they are needed most.
Furthermore, datewise charts show how grievances rate changes over time, while Genderwise views number of grievances by male and female employees.
In addition, a dedicated section captures general employees suggestions and feedback, offering valuable insights beyond formal complaints and understand broader workforce concerns.

The dashboard also includes a breakdown of counseling sessions where fos grievance officers directly supported workers and provided counseling without the need for launch of formal grievance investigation.
Officer performance is tracked through resolution Time breakdown showing how quickly cases are closed and how effectively grievances are handled across defined time slabs.
Each dashboard metric is interactive and clickable.
Users can access metric specific complaints list view AI generated summaries of complaints, separate summary of RCA and capa.
Further, clicking on each ticket number provides complete case timeline with all details and evidences to support long term monitoring.
The system also generates worker happiness and safety scores based on grievance data, counseling outcomes and verification feedback.
These scores help benchmark performance, track improvements over time, and assess the real impact of corrective actions.
Finally, all completed survey reports are archived in one place, supporting audits, trend analysis, and continuous oversight of workplace conditions.
